intro: Veronica allahuekberensis, commonly known as the Andean speedwell, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the Plantaginaceae family and is characterized by its low-growing habit and clusters of blue or purple flowers. The plant typically thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in alpine meadows. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, while its flowers are small and arranged in dense inflorescences. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
